doc.title: We Won't Bow Down
doc.plot: We Won't Bow Down follows one of the most secretive African American cultures in existence through their continued history of oppression and discrimination. From the horrors of slavery to the political and economic fall out of Hurricane Katrina, the Black Indians of New Orleans have kept their unique combination of African and Native American culture alive for centuries. By combining the cultures of two oppressed peoples the Black Indians have created true resistance through art.
